sub_title: Senior Researcher - Urban & Community Resilience and Climate Adaptation
summary:
I’m an interdisciplinary environmental scientist (social science, plus natural & humanities). I have a dual background in academia and the science-policy interface, and value strongly collaborative, transdisciplinary, and societally impactful research. My work focuses on ‘Urban & Community Resilience and Climate Adaptation under Uncertainty’, with applications in global cities, delta regions and the Arctic. Key topics include: framing & narratives, science-policy-society interfaces, visualisation & communication, and policy/governance under uncertainty & surprise.

A list of my publications can be found at:
https://arjanwardekker.wordpress.com/publications/
https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=vpkqnzAAAAAJ&hl=en

Specialties: 
- Urban & community resilience
- Climate change adaptation (e.g. water management, health, urban areas)
- Uncertainty & risk (management & policy, governance, analysis, communication, visualisation, framing & narratives)
- Environment & health, emerging risks, methodology & tools for decision-support

profile_positions.description:
I'm leading a team of researchers on my research line "Urban resilience & climate adaptation under uncertainty" at Copernicus Institute of Sustainable Development, Environmental Governance group.

I'm the Dutch project leader (PI) for the following ongoing projects:
- CoCliServ; co-developing climate services for urban and regional resilience (EU JPI Climate)
- Visual framing in climate change & environmental assessment (as Lead-PI; UiB/UL & PBL)
- SeMPER-Arctic; sensemaking, place attachment & extended networks for resilience in Arctic communities (Belmont Forum)
